meanings.definition: A person who makes or repairs sails.
meanings.sent1: The sailmakers in the harbor are skilled at fixing torn sails.
meanings.sent2: I visited the sailmakers to get a new sail for my boat.
meanings.sent3: The sailmakers had a race to see who could sew the fastest!
meanings.sent4: The sailmakers are the artists of the sea, crafting sails like painters create masterpieces.
meanings.sent5: The sailmakers' hands moved swiftly, creating sails that danced with the wind.

meanings.definition: The shop or business of a sailmaker.
meanings.sent1: I need to stop by the sailmakers to pick up my sail.
meanings.sent2: The sailmakers' shop had a wide variety of colorful sails on display.
meanings.sent3: The sailmakers' shop was so busy that they ran out of thread!
meanings.sent4: The sailmakers' shop was a treasure trove of nautical wonders.
meanings.sent5: The sailmakers' shop smelled of salt and adventure, drawing sailors from near and far.
